Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and label its body parts.
The student can show and label where the fish lives, such as lakes, rivers, or oceans.
The student can draw and label other plants and animals that live in the fish's habitat.
The student can illustrate and label the water as a resource needed by the fish to survive.
The student can demonstrate how the fish and its habitat form a system by drawing and labeling how the fish interacts with its environment (like plants or other animals it eats).
The student can show how the fish habitat provides sunlight and water which are important for other living things in the environment.
